body_content.explanation: an evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves) with long leaves like needles, found in the southwest of North America. Its white seeds are used as food:
examples: Beyond the plains are plantations of pinon, the pine nut tree.
The pine bark beetle is responsible for decimating the population of piñon pines in New Mexico.
The dry grass helps to ignite pinyon pines and juniper trees.
The piñons are so healthy and green in the wilderness.

body_content.explanation: one of the white seeds of the pinon pine, used as food:
examples: Staple ingredients include cornmeal and pinons (a southwestern variant of the pine nut).
The mild taste of the piñon nut works well in this recipe.
